p: Antibodies can induce passive immunization for either prophylaxis or therapy. The S protein is considered as a potential candidate vaccine target, where the formed antibodies against S protein could block receptor binding and entry of CoV into the cells [ 6, 88, 89]. Sui et al. identified and produced 80R, a neutralizing human monoclonal antibody, which is able to inhibit SARS-CoV entry via preventing S1 binding to ACE2 receptors [ 20]. Moreover, neutralizing human monoclonal antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 can be produced by using a soluble form of its binding receptor (ACE2) combined with an immunoglobulin Fc domain, allowing the development of long-lasting immunity against the virus [ 48].
